page.title: 17Industry - Mossmorran
page.content: After five years of construction. Mossmorran is now nearing completion. The function of the plant is essentially simple. The natural gas liquid which is piped from St. Fergus is split into four different factions and supplied to clients. The flow is regulated in the inlet surge drum on arrival and then passed into three distillation columns. Ethane, propane and butane are seperated leaving behind natural gasoline the propane is purified and both this and the butane are cooled in a refrigeration unit. The ethane after seperation passes to the Esso Chemicals ethylene plant where it is converted into ethylene. The propane and butane, however, are stored in two special tanks, two for each product, ready for shipment to clients via tankers locked into a /
